name: Hyatt Regency Coconut Point Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 2 nights last year for my anniversary. Grounds were beautiful and the hospital staff were extremely nice. Loved the morning mimosas. I'm still raving about the private beach. Warm gulf waters. Absolutely amazing. They have an adult pool so that was a plus. Room was clean and very spacious. The bed was super comfy. The view wasn't too good because we were unable to open the sliding doors due to maintenance. Our room faced the hotel entrance. We did have a nice view of the bay. Ordered room service and the food was decent. Other than that we really didn't eat on premises. Went to dinner at a great steak establishment near the property. Cant wait to go back!
reviews.title: Perfect Anniversary...

reviews.text: We first came to this resort two years ago and I was happy to be back. With two kids and two adults, the spacious rooms are a nice bonus. We arrived at the hotel around 1 am but received service as if we were arriving at a peak hour. Kudos to Jarod who was friendly and responsive and to the bellman who had our bags inside our room before we even got there from the front desk. Unlike our last stay two years ago, the hotel was completely maxed out due to the Easter Weekend - but crowds got much better the following week. Kids love the pool and Camp Coconut. Kudos to Savannah for remembering us from our last stay and for making the kids' day a great one. They also loved the ping pong table, ice cream shop and free DVD rentals. It is really nice having that option rather than bringing movies with you or even worse, paying for in-room movies. Loved the fire pit at night and the seating areas outside Magnolia for when the adults want to have a cocktail at night without the kids.
reviews.title: Spring break vacation

reviews.text: We enjoyed the boat trip over to Hickory Island although we felt sorry for those who arrived on time but were not able to make the trip due to a lack of capacity on the shuttle boats.
reviews.title: Nice retreat

reviews.text: Weather was perfect, staff was great. The property is clean and quiet and the grounds are beautiful. We spent our final night there running around the property taking pictures of all of our favorite spots on the grounds since we will likely try another location next spring break.
reviews.title: Not so standard room

reviews.text: Finally a special shout out to Jerri at the Stillwater Spa. I have had tendonitis in my left shoulder for months and she was somehow able to work through it - I can now fully extend my arm and rotate it around. Thank you!
reviews.title: Love it - very relaxing

reviews.text: So I stayed there with my husband in March for an incentive trip for work. It is a beautiful new hotel. Impressive lobby, fabulous asian-themed spa, beautiful landscaped grounds, ample parking, several pools, nice outdoor dining and drinks poolside.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! (but don't plan to leave it)

reviews.text: However, if you are looking for nightlife, look elsewhere. Bonita Springs is in between Ft. Meyers and Naples and it's a hike to either place. Also, the no-see-ums are brutal!!! I still have scars a month later from all the bugbites. You don't want to venture outdoors after dusk. I guess most of the west coast of Florida is buggy and swampy - we didn't even venture to the hotel's man-made beach, and those who did came right back on the next boat to remain poolside.
reviews.title: Nice New Resort
Outstanding Resort with Outstanding Service
reviews.text: Bottom line: come here only to relax with your family poolside, and bring lots of bug spray.
This is my first time writing a review on tripadvisor but I have been using the site for all of my vacations and do find it confusing when you see mixed reviews. Hope mine helps to clear things up.
reviews.title: What more could you possibly want?

reviews.text: We went to Flordia for a quick winter getaway at the end of March with our 2 year old daughter. The Hyatt was recently built so everything was really clean and it had lots of amenities Huge lobby (that kind of reminded me of some of the Ritz Carlton and Four Season's properties we have stayed at). They had a lot of things to do ~ lots of pools (infinity edge pool for kids so our daughter could sit in the pool and splash). The boat ride to the beach was nice (takes 10 -15 min.) We stayed on the beach for about an hour collected seashells and headed back. Its a narrow beach but it was nice to be able to go to the beach and hear the waves. (Didn't see any bugs on our trip). They had a nice bar area with chess, checkers, etc for people to play. There was a small kids arcade and outside of it were some table tennis tables. They had a cute little ice cream shop that had tiny tables for kids. My husband and I rented a bucket of golf balls and tried to hit the pin in the middle of one of the lakes. They had bikes for rent. The spa was nice (nothing incredible but who would complain about a massage). I would definitely recommend renting a car ~ like some of the other reveiws have said the resort food is ok but not really worth what they charge. We had a great meal at nearby Roys. One more negative besides price ~ you don't see the beach from the rooms (you might actually see a swampy looking area from your room or the bay). It is an expensive hotel but they usually offer deals ~ we had a $ 50 resort credit every night. We also stocked up on water/drinks and other snack items from one of the many nearby grocery stores and each room at the Hyatt has an empty fridge in the room. To sum my reveiw up, I think we got what we paid for and would recommend the resort for families.
reviews.title: nice resort...rude staff!!!
Over-rated and over priced
reviews.text: This was a Easter holiday week so we were willing to give the place a little slack. But as we encountered rude staff member after rude staff member we quickly tired of it. We really felt like we were bothering them with the simplest of request. The customer service aspect just was not present. We heard many other guests grumbling simliar complaints. The grounds were nice but the resort is set in the middle of a swamp. Lots of bogs and standing water. If you want scenic views from your hotel..do NOT go here! There are also several new high rise condos being built right next to the resort. Lots of construction noise. All in all I would sum it up as overpriced, poor service, and lacking the panoramic views most would want from a Florida resort. Do yourself a favor..do an all-inclusive vacation which won't cost all that much more....

reviews.title: First Class All the Way
reviews.text: Can't really see why everyone raves about this place. Everything onsite was expensive from the resturants to the drinks ($8-10 mixed drinks, $5 beer)

Took the family to Hyatt Coconut Point for Spring Break and spent 4 wonderful days at this amazing resort! The property is so well thought out and has thought of everything to make your stay memorable that I will make this an annual trip.
reviews.title: WHAT AN AMAZING RESORT**

reviews.text: * Breakfast team and Chef Jaime deliver a great start to your day in the three meal restaurant.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property & Outstanding Service

reviews.text: * Kids spent hours upon hours on the slide at the pool.....Great for me and my wife!
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel and Grounds!

reviews.text: * The boat ride out to the beach is a nice added offering.
reviews.title: Love, Love, Love it

reviews.text: * Close vicinity to restaurants off property for dinner! - Self Parking made it an easy trip!
reviews.title: Love this Hotel!

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this resort while I attended a convention with my company.
reviews.title: Great hotel for summer vacation

reviews.text: My 3 daughters loved the pools (especially the river pool at the nearby Vacation Club). The hotels beach was beautiful though you take a 10 minute boat ride to get there and then a 5 minute walk.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.text: Our room was beautifully appointed. We lucked out and got a Bay View and watched gorgeous sunsets every night. Try the seafood restaurant for dinner. The fried snapper is excellent and the service very good.
reviews.title: giving it a try

reviews.text: Stayed there for 6 days, end of March. Grandparents with 4 years old grandson. Perfect vacation. Very nice room , 15th floor. Very clean and well kept facility ( probably not the newest one). Excellent facility for kids, but still some section for adults only. Very friendly and efficient personel. On example - our grandson received a toy from a friends . Needs to by unscrew from a base. I ask housekeeper to help me find a phillips screwdriver. About 15 min. later somebody from on engineering dep. did fixed for me !
reviews.title: Family vacation

reviews.text: Our room balcony faced on wetland and was pleasure to watch birds flying below. Surprisingly no mosquitos in a room ( hight?).Very convenient and always available self parking. . Even arriving to the facility is impressive- 1 mile of a beautiful alley. Additional facility available ( lazy river) at the Hyatt time share , next to hotel with available transportation. In room a small refrigerator available, no kitchenette
reviews.title: Very Nice Property...but Definitely Avoid the Busy Periods

reviews.text: The private beach is not the widest one, but still very nice. The transportation by a 15 minutes boat rides is on additional fun. On each of occasion we did see dolphins and our grandson was very happy. We did eat only one time in a hotel "high" end restaurant , Tarpon bay. Expensive, but worthy. Excellent food and very professional personel.
reviews.title: Lovely pools!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not far rom hotel many shopping centers (need a car) and restaurant.
reviews.title: Very Accommodating Staff!!

reviews.text: Our granson did want to leave this facility. We promised to return
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort - Highly Recommended despite a few flaws

reviews.text: This place is a beautiful resort and well worth a 5 star ranking. I'm only going to make note of the few "wrong" things here. First, the place was sold out for several days, but we were able to get a Saturday and Sunday weekend. The extra-curricular activities (fishing, dolphin watch, etc.) planned on site were scheduled for Wednesday, Thursday and Saturday. Given a 4pm check-in time, we missed the Saturday activities. We could have booked similar activities in nearby Naples (about 30 minutes south), but the point of staying at a resort is not having to leave.
reviews.title: Beautiful, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other hand, staying here with a vehicle is also a great idea. There are grocery stores within a couple of miles to stock up on bottled water and other sundries where paying resort prices always drives me nuts.
reviews.title: Lunch at the poolside restaurant.

reviews.text: A couple of easy must-do's: take the short ferry to the "private island" for a few hours for some great dolphin viewing and visit the time share resort for the lazy river pool. There's no pressure to buy a time-share and it was nice to see the other property.
reviews.title: VERY Impressive!

reviews.text: Took some guests to the Hyatt Regency Coconut Point for lunch recently. The restaurant by the pool wasn't very busy. We ordered burgers and nachos. The burgers were cooked according to each person's order; they were juicy and flavorful. The nachos were pretty good as well. The server was pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: A+, beautiful property
It just misses out .
reviews.text: This place is not inexpensive, but it is a beautiful property. We strolled the boardwalk after lunch even though there wasn't much to see. All in all a pleasant experience, but pricey which came as no surprise.
My husband and I (we're in our mid-30s) and our 3.5-year-old son spent the last week of September 2005 at the Hyatt Regency Coconut Point Resort & Spa.
reviews.title: Great Hotel. Pricey Food.
Outstanding Vacation
reviews.text: We think this hotel is WONDERFUL.

We were looking for a relaxing vacation with not much to do (we have very busy lives with stressful jobs), and we were also looking for a hotel that would be fun for our "water-baby" (meaning great pools). The Hyatt certainly delivered.
reviews.title: a fantastic hotel
Eye candy!
reviews.text: The only negative we found to this hotel were the food prices (as mentioned by previous reviewers). I'll leave that for last.
So here it goes:
reviews.title: what a wonderful place

aka: Hyatt Regency Coconut Point Resort And Spa
description: Welcome to the Hyatt Regency Coconut Point Resort and Spa... where tropical gardens, warm breezes and sparkling waters of Florida's gulf coast create the classic retreat for any occasion. With over 73,000 square feet of flexible meeting space featuring two ballrooms, numerous banquet rooms, and abundant outdoor locations, we can accommodate gatherings from 20 to over 1,400 people. Whether large or small, each event is enhanced with innovative catering, impeccable service and state-of-the-art technology. Centrally located just minutes from the airport between Naples or Fort Myers.
